description: management of instances in Proxmox VE cluster

force.description: forcing operations can be used only with states C(present), C(stopped), C(restarted) with C(state=present) force option allow to overwrite existing container with states C(stopped) , C(restarted) allow to force stop instance

cpus.description: numbers of allocated cpus for instance

ostemplate.description: the template for VM creating required only for C(state=present)

unprivileged.description: Indicate if the container should be unprivileged

disk.description: hard disk size in GB for instance

searchdomain.description: sets DNS search domain for a container

hostname.description: the instance hostname required only for C(state=present) must be unique if vmid is not passed

state.description: Indicate desired state of the instance

swap.description: swap memory size in MB for instance

memory.description: memory size in MB for instance

pubkey.description: Public key to add to /root/.ssh/authorized_keys. This was added on Proxmox 4.2, it is ignored for earlier versions

node.description: Proxmox VE node, when new VM will be created required only for C(state=present) for another states will be autodiscovered

api_password.description: the password to authenticate with you can use PROXMOX_PASSWORD environment variable

password.description: the instance root password required only for C(state=present)

ip_address.description: specifies the address the container will be assigned

netif.description: specifies network interfaces for the container. As a hash/dictionary defining interfaces.

api_host.description: the host of the Proxmox VE cluster

vmid.description: the instance id if not set, the next available VM ID will be fetched from ProxmoxAPI. if not set, will be fetched from PromoxAPI based on the hostname

mounts.description: specifies additional mounts (separate disks) for the container. As a hash/dictionary defining mount points

nameserver.description: sets DNS server IP address for a container

onboot.description: specifies whether a VM will be started during system bootup
